prompt.content: Using Trupanion (ticker: TRUP) FY2023 10-K calculate EV/Revenue multiple. Use diluted WASO for market cap calculation. Assume share price of $50. Show the answer rounded to 2 decimals.

messages.content: [{"operator":"correctness","criteria":"FY2023 revenue = $1,108,605,000"},{"operator":"correctness","criteria":"FY2023 diluted WASO = 41,436,882 shares"},{"criteria":"Assumed share price = $50","operator":"correctness"},{"operator":"correctness","criteria":"Market Cap = 41,436,882 Ã— $50 = $2,071,844,100"},{"operator":"correctness","criteria":"Cash and cash equivalents = $147,501,000"},{"criteria":"Short-term investments = $129,667,000","operator":"correctness"},{"operator":"correctness","criteria":"Long-term investments = $12,866,000"},{"criteria":"Long-term debt current portion = $1,350,000","operator":"correctness"},{"operator":"correctness","criteria":"Long-term debt (noncurrent) = $127,580,000"},{"operator":"correctness","criteria":"Preferred stock outstanding = $0"},{"operator":"correctness","criteria":"Enterprise value formula used = market cap + current portion of long-term debt + long-term debt (noncurrent) + preferred equity - cash and equivalents - short-term investments - long-term investments"},{"operator":"correctness","criteria":"Enterprise value = $1,910,740,100"},{"criteria":"EV/Revenue multiple (rounded to 2 decimals) = 1.72","operator":"correctness"}]
